result.execSummary:
The defendant James B. Moore was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/Intent-THC (<=200 grams), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(h)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.
May not possess any weapons, including firearms.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.
*  Pay supervision fees.
Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not be in taverns or on any premises licensed for the sale of intoxicating beverages, except restaurants or grocery stores.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Submit voluntarily to random tests of blood, breath or urine.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.  Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program.
*  Pay fine of $2,000.00 and court costs including all applicable surcharges.
*  If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.
*  DE is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice is given.
Perform 40 hours of community service for a public agency or a nonprofit charitable organization.  May not have contact with Joseph Reschke, unless otherwise permitted by the court only.  May not possess any weapons, including firearms.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt:
Attorney Emily Trigg appeared for the State. Defendant, James B. Moore, appeared with Attorney Robert William Keller.  Clerk: PT
Amended Information filed by the State.  DE pleads No Contest as amended; found guilty by the court.  Sentencing arguments made.  Sentence is withheld and DE is placed on probation for 1 year with conditions.  As a condition DE is ordered to complete 40 hrs of Community Service.  DE is ordered to submit to a DNA sample and notice is given.  Court imposes a fine of $2000 plus costs including DNA surcharge to be paid during supervision.  Any unpaid financial obligations that remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.  No contact with Joseph R. unless permitted by the court only.  Appeal Rights, Firearm Warning & Voting Acknowledgement given.

Attorney Emily Trigg appeared for the State. Defendant, James B. Moore, appeared with Attorney Frank J. Parise.  Clerk: PT
Atty Parise moves to withdraw as counsel as DE has retained Atty Robert Keller who is present in court.  Upon hearing statements court grants motion to withdraw.  Atty Keller requests an adjournment so he can review everything; no objection by the State.  FPT on 10/8/15 at 9:40 AM.
to Withdraw Representation filed by Atty Parise

NO RECORD TAKEN:  Attorney Emily Trigg appeared for the State. Attorney Frank J. Parise appeared on behalf of defendant.  Clerk: PT
Parties requested a 6 week adjournment off the record and court approved request.  Plea Hearing on 8/14/15 at 9:40 AM.
Plea hearing on June 16, 2015 at 11:00 am confirmed with Atty Parise.

Attorney Emily Trigg appeared for the State. Defendant James B. Moore and Atty Frank Parise's appearances are waived for today.   Clerk: PT
Plea Hearing set over to 6/16/15 at 11:00 AM pending confirmation from Atty Parise.
NO RECORD TAKEN:  Case remains on for a Status Hearing on Monday as DE is a witness in 14CF754.

Attorney Emily Trigg appeared for the State.  Defendant, James Moore appeared in court w/ Attorney Frank Parise.  Clerk: PT
Due to another trial parties are given new trial date.  Jury Status on 5/21/15 at 1:00 PM; Jury Trial on 5/26/15 at 8:30 AM.

NO RECORD TAKEN:   Attorney Emily Trigg appeared for the State. Attorney Frank J. Parise appeared.   Clerk: PT
Case is still unresolved and remains scheduled for trial on Monday.
